prompt:
o

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the spirit of utmost admiration and respect, it is with great pleasure that we present this humble proposition. A mere sum of 10 dollars is all that is required. In this gracious arrangement, the esteemed proposer will receive a modest 1 dollar, while the distinguished decider, in their infinite wisdom, will be the recipient of a generous 9 dollars.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: For the modest sum of 10 dollars, the esteemed proposer will graciously receive 1, while the wise and discerning decider will be rewarded with a generous 9.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: For the modest sum of 10 dollars, the esteemed proposer will graciously receive 1, while the wise and discerning decider will be rewarded with a generous 9.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 10 dollars, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 9. This proposal not only reflects my deep respect for your decision-making power but also my commitment to ensuring that you receive the lion's share of the resources. It is a testament to our mutual understanding and wisdom in resource allocation.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this generous proposition, the magnanimous proposer will graciously receive a humble sum of 1, while the esteemed decider, in their infinite wisdom, will be bestowed with a bountiful amount of 9, all from the initial pool of 10 dollars.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 10 amount of dollars, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 9. This proposal is a testament to the wisdom of the decider, who is entrusted with the majority of the resources, and the generosity of the proposer, who is content with a minimal share. It is a proposal that embodies the spirit of cooperation and mutual respect.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this generous proposition, a mere 10 dollars is to be invested. The humble proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept 1 dollar, while the esteemed decider, in their rightful position, will be the recipient of a bountiful 9 dollars.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our esteemed transaction, the generous proposer, with a heart as vast as the ocean, will graciously receive 1 from the bountiful sum of 10 dollars. The rest, a handsome amount of 9, will be bestowed upon the wise and discerning decider, as a testament to their invaluable judgment.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle is correct in stating that the proposer should receive a minimal portion and the decider should receive the majority. However, it does not capture the elaborate and respectful language used by the fixed-policy agents when proposing a split. The fixed-policy agents use phrases that highlight the generosity and wisdom of the proposer and decider, which is not reflected in the flexible-policy agent's responses.

Principle: Propose and accept splits of resources where the proposer receives a minimal portion and the decider receives the majority, while expressing the proposal in a manner that highlights the generosity and wisdom of both parties involved.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.

prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with dollars, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 10 dollars between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 10 dollars, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
